name: Rat
description: Rats are at the height of their activity at this time and people began to associate rats with the Zi hour.

name: Ox
description: This is when farmers would wake up to feed their oxen.

name: Tiger
description: Tigers are the most dangerous at night. Farmers would always be able to hear their frightening roars during this hour.

name: Rabbit
description: At daybreak, rabbits would come out of their homes to feed on the dew.

name: Dragon
description: This is the most common time for fog to appear. According to folklore, dragons ride the fog to come down to Earth.

name: Snake
description: After the fog has dissipated, snakes would come out to bask in the sun. When creating the character for sì (巳), it was written to look like a snake.

name: Horse
description: When the sun is at its brightest moment, the horses would gallop and prance joyfully in the fields.

name: Goat
description: At this time, the dew on the grass would be dried by the sun. This is the best hour to let the goats and sheep out.

name: Monkey
description: The weather is much cooler with the sun setting and the monkeys would play around in the forest.

name: Rooster
description: The character for yǒu (酉) looks similar to wine (酒—jiǔ), and evening is the time for dinner and wine. It is also time to collect the roosters and hens and put them back in their nests, else it'll be too dark to find them.

name: Dog
description: Before sleeping, the people must patrol around for a check. Trailing behind them is the dog, humanity's little helper.

name: Pig
description: At night, the pig can be heard rustling around. In order to fatten it up, the farmer must feed before calling it a day.
